intro: Tenoria romana, commonly known as the Roman tenia, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves. The plant produces small, white to greenish-yellow flowers that cluster in umbels, typical of the family. Tenoria romana is often found in rocky soils and dry habitats, showcasing its adaptability to arid environments. Its historical significance is noted in ancient Roman texts, where it was referenced for its medicinal properties.
